snippet: Horace E. Kelly, a condemned triple murderer whom a jury found sane enough to be executed, is entitled to Federal court review of his death sentence and of his sanity, a Federal appeals court ruled today.    Ruling 10 to 1, the United States Court...
lead_paragraph: Horace E. Kelly, a condemned triple murderer whom a jury found sane enough to be executed, is entitled to Federal court review of his death sentence and of his sanity, a Federal appeals court ruled today. Ruling 10 to 1, the United States Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit overturned a 2-1 decision by a panel of the same court that said Mr. Kelly had forfeited his right to appeal because his lawyers missed a deadline set by a new federal law.
abstract: Federal appeals court in San Francisco rules that Horace E Kelly, condemned triple murderer whom jury found sane enough to be executed, is entitled to Federal court review of his death sentence and of his sanity (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Triple Murderer Allowed To Seek Federal Appeal
